Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 122, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 117</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11216.11" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The branches of a river</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 774</bibl>.—Hence, the river-gods were represented with horns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 371</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 7</bibl> et saep.; cf.: corniger, tauriformis, etc., and v. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">ke/ras</foreign>, V.—</sense><sense id="n11216.12" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The arm of the shore forming a harbor, a tongue of land</hi>, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 410</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.13" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The extremity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">end of the sailyards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 549</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 832</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14</bibl>. 389.—</sense><sense id="n11216.14" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The cone of a helmet in which the crest was placed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum cornu galeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.15" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The end of the stick around which books were rolled, usually ornamented with ivory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:107" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 107</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11216.16" n="h" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The side of a bow in the form of a</hi> <cb n="CORN" /> <hi rend="ital">horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 455</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 603</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.17" n="i" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The horn-shaped side of the cithara</hi> (perh. the sounding-board), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11216.18" n="k" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The top</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summit of a mountain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua Parnasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:532" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 532</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11216.19" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The point, end, extremity, wing of a place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 12, § 26 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11216.20" n="m" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The wing of an army</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl> (three times); 2, 23; 2, 25; 7, 62 (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 3</bibl> sq(seven times).—* </sense><sense id="n11216.21" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua disputationis tuae commovere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to drive back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection).—</sense><sense id="n11216.22" n="n" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The feeler</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claw</hi> of an insect, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:99 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 31, 51, § 99 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n11216.23" n="o" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The stiff hair</hi> of the Germans: <cit><quote lang="la">quis stupuit Germani lumina, flavam Caesariem et madido torquentem cornua cirro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.24" n="3" level="3"> Of objects made of horn. </sense><sense id="n11216.25" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A bow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 383</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:109 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 109 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11216.26" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A bugle-horn, a horn, trumpet</hi> (cornua, quod ea, quae nunc sunt ex aere, tunc fiebant bubulo e cornu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=117" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 117</bibl> Müll.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 265, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 620</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 615</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 533</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:315" default="NO">6, 315</bibl>.—Connected with tubae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 81</bibl>, cf. Dict. of Antiq., s. v. cornu.—In a sarcastic double sense with a.: dum tendit citharam noster, dum cornua Parthus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl> (v. the passage in connection).—</sense><sense id="n11216.27" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The sides of the lyre</hi>, originally consisting of two horns, giving resonance to the strings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 59, 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.28" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A lantern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 185</bibl>; cf. Lucr 2, 388; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.29" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An oil cruet</hi>, Hor S. 2, 2, 61.—</sense><sense id="n11216.30" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A funnel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 509</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11216.31" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as an emblem of <hi rend="ital">power, courage, strength, might</hi> (the figure taken from bullocks. Also in Heb. a very freq. metaph.; cf. Gesen. Lex. s. v. <foreign />, p. 906, 6; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne in re secundā nunc mi obvortat cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerunt capiti cornua sera meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11</bibl></cit>,: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc pauper cornua sumit,</quote> <trans><tr>gains strength, courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 239</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">. tu (sc. amphora) addis cornua pauperi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence Bacchus, as a giver of courage, is represented with horns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 30</bibl>; v. Bacchus, I.; cf. of a river-god, I. B. 2. c. supra.</sense></entryFree>
cornualis: <entryFree id="n11217" type="main" key="cornu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n11217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to horns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concertatio,</quote> <trans><tr>with the horns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cornuarius: <entryFree id="n11218" type="hapax" key="cornu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of horns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trumpets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornuatus: <entryFree id="n11219" type="main" key="cornu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horn-like, horn-shaped</hi>: umbra, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornucopiae: <entryFree id="n11220" type="main" key="Cornu_co_pi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornūcōpĭae</orth>, v. cornu, I. A. <sense id="n11220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cornulum: <entryFree id="n11221" type="main" key="cornu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n11221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little horn</hi>, = corniculum (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornum: <entryFree id="n11222" type="main" key="cornum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. cornus</etym>, <sense id="n11222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cornelcherry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 649</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 665</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 816</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11222.1" n="II" level="1"> = 1. cornus, II., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 408</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11223" type="main" key="cornum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cornu <sense id="n11223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cornupeta: <entryFree id="n11224" type="main" key="cornupe^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornupĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n11224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comm., pushing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goring with the horns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornus: <entryFree id="n11225" type="main" key="cornus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cornus, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:552" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:647" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 647</bibl>), <sense id="n11225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cornel cherry-tree</hi>: Cornus mascula, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:103 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 42, § 103 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 448</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 1 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11225.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a javelin made of cornelwood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:122" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 122</bibl>; Stat. l. l. al.; cf. 1. cornum, II.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11226" type="main" key="cornus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. cornu <sense id="n11226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11227" type="main" key="Cornus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the western coast of Sardinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:40:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 40, 5 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cornutus: <entryFree id="n11228" type="main" key="cornu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n11228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11228.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (cf. cornu, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes (i. e. elephanti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 39</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11228.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n11228.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cornūti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (= tauri), <hi rend="ital">bullocks</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 395, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 494 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n11228.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cornūtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:10:3:section=454" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 10, 3, § 454</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11228.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: syllogismus, <hi rend="ital">a horned syllogism, a sophistical conclusion, sophism</hi>, = ceratina, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69</bibl>, n. 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornuta interrogatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Helvid. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11229" type="main" key="Cornu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> cognomen. </sense><sense id="n11229.1" n="I" level="1"> Annaeus Cornutus, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian</hi>,<cb n="CORO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11229.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Cornutus, <hi rend="ital">a prætor during the consulate of</hi> Hirtius and Pansa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coroebus: <entryFree id="n11230" type="main" key="Co^roebus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏroebus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/roibos</foreign>, <sense id="n11230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Mygdon of Phrygia, who freed Cassandra. and fought for Priam against the Greeks before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 341</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 424</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corolla: <entryFree id="n11231" type="main" key="co^rolla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrolla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corona</etym>, <sense id="n11231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little crown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garland</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 13</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 63, 14</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
corollaria: <entryFree id="n11232" type="gloss" key="co^rolla_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrollārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corolla</etym>, <sense id="n11232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female merchant of flower-garlands</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4173</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a title of a drama of Nævius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 60</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
corollarium: <entryFree id="n11233" type="main" key="co^rolla_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrollārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n11233.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Money paid for a garland of flowers;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=178" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11233.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a gift, present, douceur, gratuity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tamquam festivum acroama, ne sine corollario de convivio discederet, ibidem emblemata evellenda curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 50, § 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 79, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11233.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in later philos. writings, <hi rend="ital">a corollary, deduction</hi>, Boeth. Consol. 3, pros. 10; 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
corona: <entryFree id="n11234" type="greek" key="co^ro_^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrō^na</orth> (in the ante-Aug. per. sometimes written chorona, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl>; cf. the letter C), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n11234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garland, chaplet, wreath.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11234.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of natural or artificial flowers, etc. (very freq. used for personal adornment at festivals, when sacrificing, or as a gift for friends, etc., for ornamenting the images of the gods, edifices, victims, the dead, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1399</bibl>; Lex XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 5, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:5" default="NO">4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronas bibere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to throw into the cup leaves plucked from the garlands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 12</bibl></cit>. Vid. the artt. sacerdotalis, funebris, sepulchralis, convivialis, nuptialis, natalitia, Etrusca, pactilis, plectilis, sutilis, tonsa or tonsilis, radiata, and pampinea.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perenni fronde corona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>immortal, poetic renown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 119</bibl></cit>.—As emblem of royalty, <hi rend="ital">a crown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni corona = diadema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 505</bibl></cit>. —Concerning the different kinds of garlands or crowns given to soldiers as a prize of bravery (castrensis or vallaris, civica, muralis, navalis or rostrata, obsidionalis, triumphalis, oleagina, etc.), v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.; and the artt. castrensis, civicus, muralis, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11234.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: corona fidei, <hi rend="ital">the crown of martyrdom</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 72, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and corona alone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 25, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mort. Pers. 16, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11234.3" n="B" level="2"> Sub coronā vendere, t. t. of the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to sell captives as slaves</hi> (since they were crowned with chaplets; cf. Caelius Sabinus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and corono, I.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63, 12</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub coronā venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 42, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 29, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub coronā venundari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub coronā emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11234.4" n="C" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">a constellation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11234.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The northern crown</hi> (according to the fable, the crown of Ariadne transferred to heaven; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ariadna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:351 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 351 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> German. Arat. 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Gnosia stella Coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cressa Corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariadnea Corona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:224 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 60, § 224 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n11234.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The southern crown</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> German. Arat. 391</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11234.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of objects in the form of a crown.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11234.8" n="A" level="2"> Most freq., <hi rend="ital">a circle of men, an assembly, crowd, multitude</hi> (esp. of judicial assemblies), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 53, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 1 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11234.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the besiegers round a hostile place, the line of siege</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circumvallation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:10 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 10 al.</bibl>—Also, <hi rend="ital">a circle of men for the defence of a place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11234.10" n="B" level="2"> In arch., <hi rend="ital">the cornice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 59, § 183</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11234.11" n="C" level="2"> In the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">an elevated ridge of land as a boundary line</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. 114" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. 114</bibl> and 131 Goes.—</sense><sense id="n11234.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hairy crown over the horse's hoof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:29:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11234.13" n="E" level="2"> Montium, <hi rend="ital">a circular ridge of mountains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23</bibl>, <pb n="472" /> <cb n="CORO" /> § 73.—</sense><sense id="n11234.14" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The halo round the sun</hi> (for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/lws</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronae: <entryFree id="n11235" type="main" key="Co^ro_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of the two daughters of the Theban Orion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 698</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronaeus: <entryFree id="n11236" type="main" key="Co^ro_naeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnaeus</orth>, v. Corone.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11237" type="main" key="Co^ro_naeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnaeus</orth>, v. Coronea, II. A.</entryFree>
coronalis: <entryFree id="n11238" type="hapax" key="co^ro_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corona</etym>, <sense id="n11238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a crown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>issuing from a crown</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coronamen: <entryFree id="n11239" type="main" key="co^ro_na_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>corono</etym>, <sense id="n11239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wreathing, crowning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coronamentum: <entryFree id="n11240" type="main" key="co^ro_na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowers for crowns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garlands</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 9, 28, § 52</bibl> sq.; 22, 21, 26, § 53.—</sense><sense id="n11240.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The garland</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crown itself</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronarius: <entryFree id="n11241" type="main" key="co^ro_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corona</etym>, <sense id="n11241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wreath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anemonae,</quote> <trans><tr>suitable for garlands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus naturae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>presenting a garland-like growth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans><tr>stucco-work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit> and 6; <cit><quote lang="la">but also,</quote> <trans><tr>the making of a golden crown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9</bibl></cit>, praef. 10.—Esp. freq.: coronarium aurum, <hi rend="ital">a present of gold collected in the provinces for a victorious general</hi> (orig. expended for a golden crown; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 37, 4</bibl>, and 39, 7, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">but, afterwards, in gen. for any purpose),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 230</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and under the emperors,</quote> <trans><tr>a tribute paid on the accession of an emperor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11241.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n11241.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dealer in crowns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garlands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:111" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11, 26, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 6</bibl> (2, 1).— </sense><sense id="n11241.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">she who makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vends crowns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garlands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronator: <entryFree id="n11242" type="hapax" key="co^ro_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>corono</etym>, <sense id="n11242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crowner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 318" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 318</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corone: <entryFree id="n11243" type="main" key="Co^ro_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n11243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the west coast of the Messenian bay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrō-naeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korwnai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Coronean</hi>: sinus, now the <hi rend="ital">Golfo de Coron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronea: <entryFree id="n11244" type="main" key="Co^ro_ne_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korw/neia</foreign>, <sense id="n11244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Bœotia, west of Lake Copais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29, 6</bibl> and 9 al.—</sense><sense id="n11244.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n11244.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnaeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Coronea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11244.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coroneola: <entryFree id="n11245" type="hapax" key="co^ro_ne^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n11245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [corona], <hi rend="ital">an autumnal rose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 19</bibl> (coronioia, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
coroneus: <entryFree id="n11246" type="main" key="Co^ro_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korwneu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king in Phocis, father of Corone, who was changed to a crow</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*korw/nh</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 569</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronides: <entryFree id="n11247" type="main" key="Co^ro_ni_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 2. Coronis, II.</entryFree>
coroniola: <entryFree id="n11248" type="main" key="co^ro_ni^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corona</etym>, <sense id="n11248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of autumnal rose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 19 <hi rend="ital">bis</hi></bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronis: <entryFree id="n11249" type="greek" key="co^ro_nis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korwni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a curved line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flourish formed with a pen, which writers or transcribers were accustomed to make at the end of a book or chapter;</hi> hence, as in Gr. (cf. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">korwni/s</foreign>), for <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>: serā coronide longus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11250" type="main" key="Co^ro_nis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korwni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of the Thessalian Phlegyas, mother of Æsculapius by Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 161" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 161</bibl> and 202; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 618</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Coronida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 599</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11250.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrōnīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korwnei/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Coronis</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Æsculapius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 624</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corono: <entryFree id="n11251" type="main" key="co^ro_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>corona</etym>, <sense id="n11251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish with a garland</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crown, to crown, wreathe</hi> (class., esp. freq. in the poets). </sense><sense id="n11251.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, aliquid or aliquem: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 264</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postes lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 10, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">deos fragili myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:335" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 528</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum cratera coronā Induit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 525</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">crateras magnos statuunt et vina coronant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 724</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 147</bibl> Forbig. ad loc. (cf. Nitsch. ad Hom. Od. 1, 419; Buttman, Lexil. 2, p. 100; others, less correctly, render, fill to the brim, comparing <foreign lang="greek">krath=ras e)peste/yanto potoi=o</foreign>, Hom. Il. 1, 470): <cit><quote lang="la">epulae quas inibant propinqui coronati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Mid.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederā coronantur Bacchico ritu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CORP" /> —In the Gr. constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronatus malobathro Syrio capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno (459 A. U. C.) coronati primum ob res bello bene gestas ludos Romanos spectaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 47, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the crowning of victors (soldiers, poets, pugilists, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:11" default="NO">11, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 4, 5, § 19 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also comoediam de sententiā judicum,</quote> <trans><tr>to award the prize to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl></cit>.—Unusual constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc de oratoribus coronatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>crowned as victor in the contest with the orators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphare de aliquo, s. v. triumpho, I. A.).—And in the Gr. manner: quis ... Magna coronari contemnat Olympia?</quote> <trans><tr>to be crowned in the Olympic games</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—To the crowning of captives for sale (cf. corona, I. B.) reference is made in the passage: ut coronatus veniat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 4, 5.—</sense><sense id="n11251.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to receive as the prize of victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine novo coronari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 5, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11251.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surround, encompass, enclose something in a circular form, to wreathe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervices collumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silva coronat aquas cingens latus omne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 388</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:335" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra suggesta humo (previously praecingit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem abitum custode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 380</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus densā statione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem itineribus (stellarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coronopus: <entryFree id="n11252" type="greek" key="co^ro_no^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnŏpūs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">korwno/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n11252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crowfoot;</hi> acc. to Sprengel, Plantago coronopus, <hi rend="ital">buckshorn-plantain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 59, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 19, 22, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coronula: <entryFree id="n11253" type="main" key="co^ro_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrōnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corona, II. D.</etym>. <sense id="n11253.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The ornament on a mitre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:39:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 39, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11253.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The rim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">border of the base of a laver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 3</bibl>, Reg. 7, 29.—</sense><sense id="n11253.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little crown above the horse's hoof</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 55, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corporalis: <entryFree id="n11254" type="main" key="corpo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n11254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corporeal, pertaining to the body</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in the jurists): voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam Stoici corporalem dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 117:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 117, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicimus quaedam corporalia esse, quaedam incorporalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">corporally, bodily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corporalitas: <entryFree id="n11255" type="main" key="corpo^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corporalis</etym>, <sense id="n11255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corporality</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corporaliter: <entryFree id="n11256" type="main" key="corpo^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. corporalis <sense id="n11256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
corporasco: <entryFree id="n11257" type="main" key="corpo^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n11257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [corpus], <hi rend="ital">to assume a body, become incarnate</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corporatio: <entryFree id="n11258" type="main" key="corpo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corporo</etym>, <sense id="n11258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assuming of a body, incarnation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 732</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corporativus: <entryFree id="n11259" type="main" key="corpo^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corporatus</etym>, <sense id="n11259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the forming of a body</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adjutoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:6:183" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 6, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corporatura: <entryFree id="n11260" type="main" key="corpo^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the corporeal nature</hi> or <hi rend="ital">structure</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corporatus: <entryFree id="n11261" type="main" key="corpo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. corporo <sense id="n11261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
corporeus: <entryFree id="n11262" type="main" key="corpo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n11262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corporeal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11262.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Lucr.): corporeum et aspectabile itemque tractabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 303</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:330" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 330</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e principiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 527</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 542</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. incorporeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 607</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11262.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11262.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Composed of flesh, fleshly</hi> (several times in Ov. and Plin. the elder): <cit><quote lang="la">umerus (Pelopis, opp. eburneus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne gallinaceis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cochleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 48, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11262.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. just before: is qui corporibus animantium continetur, res, <hi rend="ital">physical advantages</hi> (as health, beauty, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corporicida: <entryFree id="n11263" type="gloss" key="corpo^ri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>corpus-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n11263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">makelliths</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
corporo: <entryFree id="n11264" type="main" key="corpo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n11264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashion into a body, to furnish with a body.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11264.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">semen tempore ipso animatur corporaturque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 148</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporatus Christus et veste carnis indutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl>: undique <cb n="CORP" /> mundus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl> B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n11264.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11264.3" n="A" level="2"> Of a picture: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pictura) prius quam coloribus corporatur, umbra tingitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 37, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11264.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make a body</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corpse</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>: corporare est interficere et quasi corpus solum sine animā relinquere, Enn. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 20, 21 sq.</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:Rel. v. 101" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Rel. v. 604" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 604</bibl> Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n11264.5" n="C" level="2"> <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (acc. to corpus, II.): ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a member of a corporation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">496, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
corporosus: <entryFree id="n11265" type="hapax" key="corpo^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n11265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corpulent, gross</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corpulentia: <entryFree id="n11266" type="main" key="corpu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corpulentus</etym>, <sense id="n11266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corpulence, grossness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleshiness of body</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 118, § 283</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11266.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Corporeity</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
corpulentus: <entryFree id="n11267" type="main" key="corpu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n11267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corpulent, fleshy, fat</hi> (rare, and only anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpulentior atque habitior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litigator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo corpulentus et pinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11267.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Great</hi>: corpulentis Ennius pro magnis dixit, nos corpulentum dicimus corporis obesi hominem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 12</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n11267.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Physical, corporeal</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corpus: <entryFree id="n11268" type="main" key="corpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. kar-, to make; Lat. creo</etym>, <sense id="n11268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any object composed of materials perceptible by the senses, body, substance</hi> (opp. anima and animus; cf. the definition in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 30</bibl> pr.). </sense><sense id="n11268.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very frequent in every period and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11268.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a body</hi>, whether living or lifeless: <cit><quote lang="la">tangere aut tangi nisi corpus nulla potest res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi voluptates et dolores nasci fatemur e corporis voluptatibus et doloribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita, quae corpore et spiritu continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvissima quaeque Corpora constabunt ex partibus infinitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignea rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terraï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbum Neptuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 232</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <number>plur.</number> for <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudabant corpora (nymphae) venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 527</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 52</bibl> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">sw/mata</foreign>, Soph. Elec. 1232).—</sense><sense id="n11268.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11268.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The flesh of animal bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa subjecta corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl>, prooem. § 24; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 5: amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become poor, lean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1038</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit corpusque colorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 141</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and the opp. facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become fat, to thrive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cibo fecisti tantum corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—In a play upon words: <cit><quote lang="la">inque omni nusquam corpore corpus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11268.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the wood under the bark of a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 234</bibl>.—Of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">nervis illis, quibus causa continetur, adiciunt superinducti corporis speciem,</quote> <trans><tr>the covering, integument</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:5" default="NO">2, 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus eloquentiae facere,</quote> <trans><tr>the substance, the most essential part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus orationis enervatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11268.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lifeless body, a corpse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 8</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 548</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:835 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 835 al.</bibl>—In a double sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 89</bibl> Halm.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the souls of the dead, the shades</hi> or <hi rend="ital">departed spirits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 306</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11268.7" n="3" level="3"> As opposed to the head, <hi rend="ital">the trunk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 794</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11268.8" n="4" level="3"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">the body, person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usuram ejus corporis cepit sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae corpus puplicat volgo suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore quaestum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 21 al.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. quaestus.— Hence also,</quote> <trans><tr>the testicles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11268.9" n="5" level="3"> Periphrastically for <hi rend="ital">the individual, the person</hi> (esp. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, to suggest that which is physically admirable or excellent; <cit><quote lang="la">also freq. in the histt.): delecta virum corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectissima matrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pulchrior alter non fuit, excepto corpore Turni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 650</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 690: septena quot annis Corpora natorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultor vestrae, fidissima corpora, mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 655</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:105" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:653" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 653</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugum vestraque ac liberorum vestrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">uti corpora nostra ab injuriā tuta forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 46, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui liberum corpus (sc. Virginiam) in servitutem addixissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 56, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:33:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 33, 1</bibl>.—Of animals: corpora<pb n="473" /> <cb n="CORR" />  magna boum, <hi rend="ital">heads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu quis Pascit equos ... Corpora praecipue matrum legat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tribus corporibus triginta milia talentum auri precatur accipias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11268.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a whole composed of parts united, a body, frame, system, structure, community, corporation</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of ships,</quote> <trans><tr>the framework</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl></cit>.—Of fortifications: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus coronā militum cingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>.—Of a land: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia dirempta velut a corpore majore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of the state: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum (praeceptum Platonis), ut totum corpus rei publicae curent, nec dum partem aliquam tuentur, reliquas deserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (multitudo) coalescere in populi unius corpus poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 3</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum civitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>a political body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus Macedoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui corporis regem creari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus mercatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>guild</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpori valido caput deerat (sc. exercitui dux),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriundi ab Sabinis sui corporis creari regem volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 34, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrorum et naviculariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utros ejus habueris libros ... duo enim sunt corpora ... an utrosque, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (13), 4; so of <hi rend="ital">a book</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:50 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 50 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus omnis Romani juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Corpus Juris,</quote> <trans><tr>title of a Roman collection of laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia maternae hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:31:79" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 31, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corpusculum: <entryFree id="n11269" type="main" key="corpuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corpuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n11269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little body</hi>, most freq. of atoms, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:530" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 530</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:199" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantula hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11269.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: florum, i.e. <hi rend="ital">a collection</hi>, Just. praef. —</sense><sense id="n11269.2" n="II" level="1"> As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">melliculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corrado: <entryFree id="n11270" type="main" key="corra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rādo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scrape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rake together</hi> (rare; mostly anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n11270.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 304</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 444</bibl>.—Esp., of money, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:4 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 4 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the collecting together of one's effects for sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n11270.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to procure with difficulty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem dictis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 402</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
