corrasus: <entryFree id="n11271" type="main" key="corra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrāsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from corrado.</entryFree>
corrationalitas: <entryFree id="n11272" type="hapax" key="corra^ti^o_na_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rătĭōnālĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">analogy</hi> ( = analogia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Music. 6:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Music. 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
correctio: <entryFree id="n11273" type="main" key="correcti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correctĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrigo</etym>, <sense id="n11273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an amendment, improvement, correction.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11273.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">correctio et emendatio philosophiae veteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris Academiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quādam adhibita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicto dolere, correctione gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11273.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as a rhet. figure, <hi rend="ital">the recalling of a word in order to use a stronger or more significant one in its place</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pano/rqwsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">correctio est, quae tollit id, quod dictum est, et pro eo, id, quod magis idoneum videtur, reponit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 26, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:88" default="NO">9, 3, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrector: <entryFree id="n11274" type="main" key="corrector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corrector, improver.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11274.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corrector atque emendator nostrae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitatis et invidiae et irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus legum usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:10:7 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 10, 7 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrector Bestius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a preacher of morals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessimus quisque correctorem asperrime patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:36:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 36, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11274.2" n="II" level="1"> In the time of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">the title of a kind of land-bailiff, a governor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
correctura: <entryFree id="n11275" type="main" key="correctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correctūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrector, II.</etym>, <sense id="n11275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> corrector, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:39" default="NO">39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 24, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
correctus: <entryFree id="n11276" type="main" key="correctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from corrigo.</entryFree>
correcumbens: <entryFree id="n11277" type="hapax" key="corre^cumbens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rĕcumbens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [recumbo], <sense id="n11277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying down with</hi> any one, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. An. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corregionales: <entryFree id="n11278" type="main" key="corre^gi^o_na_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrĕgĭōnāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>con-regio</etym>, <sense id="n11278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the adjoining people</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 17.</sense></entryFree>
corregno: <entryFree id="n11279" type="main" key="corregno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-regno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n11279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to reign</hi> <cb n="CORR" /> <hi rend="ital">together with one</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 25, 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
correpo: <entryFree id="n11280" type="main" key="corre_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rēpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>psi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slink to a place, to creep</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">intra murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">15: in aliquam onerariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: correpunt membra pavore, <hi rend="ital">creep</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1218</bibl>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">in dumeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 68</bibl></cit> (v. Schoemann ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
correpte: <entryFree id="n11281" type="main" key="correpte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>corripio</etym>, <sense id="n11281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shortly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
correptio: <entryFree id="n11282" type="main" key="correpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (not ante-Aug., and rare). <sense id="n11282.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A laying hold of, seizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(morbi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 171" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11282.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">reproof, reproach</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11282.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shortening, decreasing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum (opp. crescentia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae (opp. productio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
correpto: <entryFree id="n11283" type="main" key="correpto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correpto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. freq.</hi> [correpo], <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">rursum matris in alvum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
correptor: <entryFree id="n11284" type="spur" key="correptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>corripio</etym>, <sense id="n11284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reprover, censurer</hi> (cf. correptio, I. B.); the reading of some editions of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:10:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 10, 7</bibl>, and 3, 36, 4, for which Haase has corrector, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
correptus: <entryFree id="n11285" type="main" key="correptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">correptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from corripio.</entryFree>
corresupinatus: <entryFree id="n11286" type="hapax" key="corre^su^pi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rĕsŭpīnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [resupino], <sense id="n11286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent backwards at the same time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corresuscito: <entryFree id="n11287" type="main" key="corre^susci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rĕsuscĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to raise from the dead together</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 1, 38 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
correus: <entryFree id="n11288" type="hapax" key="corre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a partaker in guilt, a joint criminal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 3, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrhagon: <entryFree id="n11289" type="main" key="Corrha^gon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corrhăgon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-gum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrideo: <entryFree id="n11290" type="main" key="corri_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rīdĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n11290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to laugh together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aloud</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n11290.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11290.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfusa lepore Omnia corrident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corrigia: <entryFree id="n11291" type="main" key="corri_^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrī^gĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrigo</etym>. <sense id="n11291.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shoe-tie, shoe-latchet</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 448, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 12, § 35</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11291.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rein for a horse</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 26.</sense></entryFree>
corrigo: <entryFree id="n11292" type="main" key="corri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>rexi, rectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n11292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make straight, set right, bring into order.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11292.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">catenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui digitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbaque correctis incidere talia ceris,</quote> <trans><tr>smoothed out, erased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 529</bibl></cit>: corpus informe gibbo, Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvas conversas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 13, § 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">malas labentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum (navis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se flexus (fluminum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11292.2" n="B" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">curva,</quote> <trans><tr>to attempt to make crooked straight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 8, 3</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n11292.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to improve, amend, correct, make better, reform, restore, make good, compensate for</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11292.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11292.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem corruptum ad frugem corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnatum mi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mutat, ut ea, quae corrigere volt, mihi quidem depravare videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita magis reprehendi possunt quam corrigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditatem cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl></cit> (15 a), 2: errorem paenitendo, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores (opp. corrumpere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, mores (with vitia emendare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptam in Illyrico ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid corrigere est nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum resque sinit, tua corrigo vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram celeri cessataque tempora cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:670" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipitis fortuna temporis maturā virtute correcta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi sit qui te conrigere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterer vos ipsā re conrigi, quoniam verba contemnitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ut umquam te corrigas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota civitas corrigi solet continentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā ratione malevolus, aliā amator corrigendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscius mihi sum ... corrigi me posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 42, 8</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. of improving, correcting an (oral or written) discourse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 9</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl>, B, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:438 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 438 al.</bibl>; and of the orator who employs the figure correctio<cb n="CORR" />  (v. s. v. II.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum corrigimus nosmet ipsos quasi reprehendentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11292.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fateri admissum flagitium: sed eosdem correcturos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11292.7" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to heal, cure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentigines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maciem corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem in facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 144</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., improved, amended, correct</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut is qui fortuito deliquit, attentior fiat correctiorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">correctus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who is reformed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil officiunt peccata vetera correcti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corripio: <entryFree id="n11293" type="main" key="corri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rĭpĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>rĭpŭi, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n11293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seize</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snatch up, to collect, to seize upon, take hold of</hi> (very freq., and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n11293.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11293.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem conripi ac suspendi jussit in oleastro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 109</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:217 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 217 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcumque manu celeresque sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 188</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lora manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110</bibl></cit> et saep.: corpus, <hi rend="ital">to rise up quickly, start up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 572</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1000" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1000</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e stratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 176</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rise up hastily, to betake one's self</hi> somewhere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 472</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: viam, gradum, spatium, etc., <hi rend="ital">to set out quickly, to pursue hastily, to hasten, hasten through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 418</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:132 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 132 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">correptā luce diei,</quote> <trans><tr>collected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11293.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11293.4" n="1" level="3"> Of robbery, etc., <hi rend="ital">to carry off, rob, plunder, take possession of, usurp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias undique quasi in subsidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona vivorum ac mortuorum usquequaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacram effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecturas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11293.5" n="2" level="3"> In Tac. freq. of accusations, <hi rend="ital">to bring to trial, accuse, inform against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellius accusatione corripitur, deferente Junio Lupo senatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 49</bibl>; 6, 40 al.—</sense><sense id="n11293.6" n="3" level="3"> Of fire, etc., or of diseases, <hi rend="ital">to attack, seize, sweep</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carry away</hi> (freq. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">turbine caelesti subito correptus et igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 395</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma Corripuit tabulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 537</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:210 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 210 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. to the person: ipsas ignes corripuere casas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:524" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec singula morbi Corpora corripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo bis inter res agendas correptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely of death: subitā morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ales) caeco correpta veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(segetes) modo sol nimius, nimius modo corripit imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 483</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (paralytici) correpti non sunt, diutius quidem vivunt, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 47, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11293.7" n="4" level="3"> With the access. idea of lessening by compressing, <hi rend="ital">to draw together, draw in, contract, shorten, abridge, diminish</hi> (rare; mostly post-Aug.): singulos a septenis spatiis ad quina corripuit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of discourse: quae nimium corripientes omnia sequitur obscuritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of words in the number of syllables (trabs from trabes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">or in the length of syllables,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO">10, 1, 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so of syllables (opp. producere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. porrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>, and later grammarians.—In time: <cit><quote lang="la">numina corripiant moras,</quote> <trans><tr>shorten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut difficiles puerperiorum tricas Juno mulceat corripiatque Lucina?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11293.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11293.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reproach, reprove, chide, blame</hi> (first freq. after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): hi omnes convicio L. Lentuli consulis correpti exagitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: clamoribus maximis judices corripuerunt, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>; so with <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impransi correptus voce magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cetera turba suorum corripiunt dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:565 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 565 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum non inimice corripere, sed paene patrie monere videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:69 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 69 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corripientibus amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>.—As a figure of speech, Cels. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11293.10" n="B" level="2"> Of the passions, emotions, etc., <hi rend="ital">to seize upon, attack</hi> (rare, <pb n="474" /> <cb n="CORR" /> and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc plausus hiantem ... plebisque patrumque Corripuit ( = animum commovit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">correpta cupidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 734</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:455" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 455</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplici ardore (sc. amoris et vini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: militiā (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for militiae studio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 584</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagine visae formae,</quote> <trans><tr>seized, fascinated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 676</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corrivalis: <entryFree id="n11294" type="hapax" key="corri_va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rīvālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint rival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 14:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 14, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrivatio: <entryFree id="n11295" type="main" key="corri_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrīvātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrivo</etym>, <sense id="n11295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing together of streams of water</hi> (Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">aquae pluviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:74" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 4, 21, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:124" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrivium: <entryFree id="n11296" type="main" key="corri_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrīvĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cum-rivis</etym>, <sense id="n11296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the confluence of brooks</hi>: conriviis Idaeis, Auct. Itin. Alex. Magn. 19 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
corrivo: <entryFree id="n11297" type="main" key="corri_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rīvo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to conduct streams of water together, to draw together into one stream</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">venas aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:19:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 30, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberim piscinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corroboramentum: <entryFree id="n11298" type="hapax" key="corro_bo^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrōbŏrāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>corroboro</etym>, <sense id="n11298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of strengthening;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitia et corroboramenta virtutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 12, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corroboro: <entryFree id="n11299" type="main" key="corro_bo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rōbŏro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to strengthen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invigorate, to make strong, to corroborate</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n11299.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puerilis tua vox) se corroboravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is jam se corroboravisset ac vir inter viros esset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had become stronger, greater, was grown up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentis membrorum partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem opere assiduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11299.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens hominis usque eo philosophiam ipsam corroborat, ut virtutem efficiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corroborare et confirmare ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae famam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem nascentem non credendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciam sceleratissimi hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corroco: <entryFree id="n11300" type="main" key="corro^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrŏco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, now unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrodo: <entryFree id="n11301" type="main" key="corro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rōdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to gnaw, gnaw to pieces</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Platonis Politiam (mures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ter</hi>: ossa, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrogatio: <entryFree id="n11302" type="main" key="corro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrŏgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrogo</etym>, <sense id="n11302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 32, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrogo: <entryFree id="n11303" type="main" key="corro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rŏgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bring together by entreaty, to bring together, collect</hi> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">suos necessarios ab atriis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of personal objects,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia ab sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ad necessarios sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummulos de nepotum donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela cum antennis ex navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 48, 5 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
corrosus: <entryFree id="n11304" type="main" key="corro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from corrodo.</entryFree>
corrotundo: <entryFree id="n11305" type="main" key="corro^tundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rŏtundo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make round, to round off</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n11305.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cometarum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:4:3:5" default="NO">4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11305.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">enthymemata sua gestu velut corrotundant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 102</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11305.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of money (cf. rotundo, and our phrase, a round sum), <hi rend="ital">to make up a sum of money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centies sestertium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corruda: <entryFree id="n11306" type="main" key="corru_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrūda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild asparagus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corrugis: <entryFree id="n11307" type="main" key="corru_gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rūgis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ruga</etym>, <sense id="n11307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having wrinkles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">folds, corrugate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus (chlamydis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corrugo: <entryFree id="n11308" type="main" key="corru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rūgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), no <sense id="n11308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to make full of wrinkles, to wrinkle, corrugate</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">olivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">acina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 39, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sordida mappa Corruget nares,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>produce loathing, cause disgust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
corrugus: <entryFree id="n11309" type="hapax" key="corru_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corrūgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>of the same stem with arrugia</etym>; <sense id="n11309.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in the lang. of mining,</quote> <trans><tr>a canal, water-conduit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corrumpo: <entryFree id="n11310" type="main" key="corrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rumpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>rāpi</itype>, ruptum <cb n="CORR" /> (rumptum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (orig., <sense id="n11310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break to pieces;</hi> hence), </sense><sense id="n11310.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy, ruin, waste, bring to naught</hi> (class., but less freq. than in the signif. II.]. </sense><sense id="n11310.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum frumentum flumine atque incendio corruperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum et semet igni conrumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plura igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 92:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 92, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">92, 8: res familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues dentibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit> (13).—</sense><sense id="n11310.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo male'st: corrupta sum atque absumpta sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suasque spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos dubitando et dies prolatando magnas opportunitates corrumpere,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:303" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem prospectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:34 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 34 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11310.4" n="II" level="1"> With regard to the physical or moral quality of an object, <hi rend="ital">to corrupt, mar, injure, spoil, adulterate, make worse</hi>, etc. (very freq., and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n11310.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrumpitur jam cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 102</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusa aqua facile conrumpitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrupitque lacus, infecit pabula leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria igni ac lapidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne plora, oculos corrumpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ocellos lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus febribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19</bibl></cit> (20), 117; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum (medicamentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 137" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor ex hordeo aut frumento in quandam similitudinem vini corruptus,</quote> <trans><tr>fermented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum in acorem corrumpitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, without the access. idea of impairing: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur corrumpitur ostro,</quote> <trans><tr>is stained</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 308</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11310.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (so most freq.), </sense><sense id="n11310.7" n="1" level="3"> Of personal objects, <hi rend="ital">to corrupt, seduce, entice, mislead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perde rem, Corrumpe erilem filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 27</bibl> sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex amore hujus esse corrumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">feminas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitiosi principes) non solum obsunt, ipsi quod corrumpuntur, sed etiam quod corrumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (milites) soluto imperio, licentia atque lascivia corruperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 53, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11310.8" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to gain to one's self by gifts</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to bribe, buy over</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11310.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio, Cic'. Caecin. 25, 72: turpi largitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Planc. 15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 57</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11310.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne alios corrumpas, cum me non potueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 3, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 9</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11310.11" n="2" level="3"> Of things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to corrupt, adulterate, falsify, spoil, mar</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras publicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas publicas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>, § 104; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores civitatis (opp. corrigere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides, quam nec cupiditas corrumpat, nec gratia avertat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem generibus corrumpitur oratio, quot ornatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen eorum paulatim Libyes corrupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:195" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo dolore corrupta voluptas,</quote> <trans><tr>imbittered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to forfeit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(littera) continuata cum insequente in naturam ejus corrumpitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oris plurima vitia in peregrinum sonum corrupti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis sciam non corrumpi in deterius quae aliquando etiam a malis ... fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineluctabilis fatorum vis consilia corrumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11310.12" n="b" level="4"> In partic. (acc. to II. B. b.), <hi rend="ital">to bribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricis fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 461</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-ruptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-, cŏrup-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., spoiled, marred, corrupted, bad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11310.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1135</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 138</bibl></cit>: aqua corruptior jam salsiorque, Auct. B. Alex. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter factum corruptius imbri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:95 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 95 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11310.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11310.15" n="1" level="3"> Of the forms of words, <hi rend="ital">mutilated, corrupted</hi> (opp. integer), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11310.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bad, corrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis corruptor juventutis, quis corruptus, qui? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines conruptissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">corrupta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the spoiled parts</hi> (of the body), Cels. praef. § 43.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">corruptly, perversely, incorrectly</hi> (very rare): judicare neque depravate neque corrupte, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl>: pronuntiare verba, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> <cb n="CORR" /> <hi rend="ital">a mutilated manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intimi libertorum servorumque corruptius quam in privatā domo habiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. 2, 12 Halm.</sense></entryFree>
corruo: <entryFree id="n11311" type="main" key="corru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-rŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n11311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11311.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11311.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall together, fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumble down, fall, sink to the ground</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n11311.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernae mihi duae corruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes corruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium supra convivas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid superstruxeris corruet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid labefactum viribus ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 403</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor labefacta Ictibus innumeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:777" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 777</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae equestres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">paene ille timore, ego risu conrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit> (10), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">nec corruit ille, Sed retinente manum moriens e poste pependit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 126</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exspirantes corruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo comitiali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedus ante focos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 19, 14; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 10, 15 sq.—</sense><sense id="n11311.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si uno meo fato et tu et omnes mei conruistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto altius elatus erat, eo foedius corruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemoniorum opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochea ista universa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 98</bibl></cit>.—Of actors: <cit><quote lang="la">ii mihi videntur fabulam aetatis peregisse, nec tamquam inexercitati histriones corruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 64</bibl></cit>.—In a cause in court, <hi rend="ital">to fail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11311.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall, to rush headlong</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quo cum corruit haec vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 825</bibl></cit>: accipitres velut rostris inter se corruerent, <hi rend="ital">were falling upon each other</hi> (al. leg. concurrerent), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe violentius semper ex necessitate quam ex virtute corruitur,</quote> <trans><tr>the onset is made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:59:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 59, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11311.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to bring to the ground, to heap together, overthrow, ruin</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n11311.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rerum summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias,</quote> <trans><tr>to heap up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corbes ab eo quod eo spicas aliudve quid corruebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=139" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 139</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n11311.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo me corruerit genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corrupte: <entryFree id="n11312" type="main" key="corrupte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. corrumpo, <sense id="n11312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
corruptela: <entryFree id="n11313" type="main" key="corrupte_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptēla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), ante-class. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">corrumptēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrumpo</etym>, <sense id="n11313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which corrupts, a corrupting, corruption, seduction, bribery</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11313.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (freq. and class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">mores hac (sc. cantūs) dulcedine corruptelaque depravati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collapsus est hic in corruptelam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (adulescentulum) corruptelarum illecebris irretisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupra dico et corruptelas et adulteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via una corruptelae Bacchanalia erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: malae consuetudinis (<hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 33</bibl>: mulierum (<hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11313.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto). </sense><sense id="n11313.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A corrupter, seducer, misleader</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrūm liberūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is apud scortum corrumptelast liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11313.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place of seduction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 76" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corruptibilis: <entryFree id="n11314" type="main" key="corrupti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liable to decay, corruptible, perishable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 68 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Vera Relig. 41" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Vera Relig. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corruptibilitas: <entryFree id="n11315" type="main" key="corrupti^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptĭbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corruptibilis</etym>, <sense id="n11315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corruptibility, perishableness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corruptio: <entryFree id="n11316" type="main" key="corrupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n11316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [corrumpo]. </sense><sense id="n11316.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., a corrupting, spoiling, seducing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <trans><tr>bribery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:6:15, p. 131" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 6, 15, p. 131</bibl></cit> Bait. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo usque corruptionis provectus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11316.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., a corrupt condition, corruption</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">totius corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11316.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corruptivus: <entryFree id="n11317" type="main" key="corrupti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corruptible, perishable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 50</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, Boëth Arist. Top. 7, 2, p. 721.</sense></entryFree>
corruptor: <entryFree id="n11318" type="main" key="corruptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">conr-; corrumptor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 14</bibl> Ritschl), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corrupter, misleader, seducer, briber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebricolarum hominum (amor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: estne in corruptorem <pb n="475" /> <cb n="CORT" /> marito justior potestas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 63</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virginum Vestalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus venditor et corruptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corruptorius: <entryFree id="n11319" type="main" key="corrupto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corrumpo</etym>, <sense id="n11319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructible, corruptible, perishable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus in homine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
corruptrix: <entryFree id="n11320" type="main" key="corruptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corruptor</etym>, <sense id="n11320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that corrupts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seduces;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adj., corrupting</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tam depravatis moribus, tam corruptrice provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia, rerum corruptrix et morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corruptus: <entryFree id="n11321" type="main" key="corruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from corrumpo.</entryFree>
