P. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">280</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 64 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11409.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11409.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tragedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11409.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A subject of tragedy</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11409.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An elevated style</hi>, in poetry, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 34, 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 68</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">also in painting,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 111</bibl></cit> (with gravitas artis).—</sense><sense id="n11409.9" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Elevation, majesty</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoriae auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coticula: <entryFree id="n11410" type="main" key="co_ti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōtĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cos</etym>. <sense id="n11410.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small touchstone, a test</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ba/sanos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 43, § 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11410.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small stone mortar</hi> for medical use, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotidianus: <entryFree id="n11411" type="main" key="co_^ti_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^tīdĭānus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏtīdĭe</orth>, etc., v. cottid-.</entryFree>
cotinus: <entryFree id="n11412" type="main" key="co^ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub that furnishes a purple color</hi>: Rhus cotinus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotio: <entryFree id="n11413" type="main" key="co_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōtio</orth>, v. cocio.</entryFree>
cotiso: <entryFree id="n11414" type="main" key="Co^ti^so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtĭso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Getæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 63</bibl>; called also <hi rend="ital">king of the Dacians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotonea: <entryFree id="n11415" type="main" key="co^to_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtōnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, wallwort, comfrey, black briony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 26, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotonius: <entryFree id="n11416" type="main" key="co^to_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtōnĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cydonius.</entryFree>
cotoriae: <entryFree id="n11417" type="main" key="co_to_ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōtōrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cos</etym>, <sense id="n11417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whetstonequarry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 15</bibl> (al. cotariae).</sense></entryFree>
cotta: <entryFree id="n11418" type="main" key="Cotta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cotta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Aurelius.</entryFree>
cottabus: <entryFree id="n11419" type="greek" key="cotta^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cottăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/ttabos</foreign> (a social sport consisting in dashing a liquid upon a brazen vessel; v. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">ko/ttabos</foreign>; hence humorously transf.), <sense id="n11419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clap, stroke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne bubuli in te cottabi crebri crepent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cottana: <entryFree id="n11420" type="foreign" key="cotta^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cottăna</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cotona</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coctona</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coctăna</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Syrian; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/ttana</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small Syrian fig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 10, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:52" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:28 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 28 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cottidianus: <entryFree id="n11421" type="main" key="cotti_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cottīdĭānus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^tīd-</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtīd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> (cŏtīd-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl>; <sense id="n11421.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but cōtĭd-,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 139</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cottidie</etym>. </sense><sense id="n11421.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n11421.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of every day, daily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agger,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 64</bibl></cit>: sumptus, Nep. Dion; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 2: cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidianis diebus = cottidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11421.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <pb n="477" /> <cb n="COXA" /> <hi rend="ital">abl. adverb.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cottīdĭāno</orth> = cottidie, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi cottidiano sesquiopus confeceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 66</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> I. p. 177</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 369 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut cotidiano in forum mille hominum descenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; Front. ap. Charis. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n11421.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">every day, daily, usual, ordinary, common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sindon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cottidie: <entryFree id="n11422" type="main" key="cotti_di^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cottī-dĭē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtīdĭē</orth> (v. Osann ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:page=475" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. p. 475</bibl>; less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtīdĭē</orth>, v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 676 sq.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quotdies</etym>, <sense id="n11422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daily</hi> (class.; cf. in dies): ibatne ad Bacchidem? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Cotidie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie vel potius in dies singulos breviores litteras ad te mitto: cotidie enim magis suspicor te in Epirum profectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te cotidie pluris facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tua justitia et lenitas animi florescet cotidie magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the night, <hi rend="ital">every night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cottidio: <entryFree id="n11423" type="main" key="cotti_di^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cottīdĭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cotīd-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, for cottidie, <sense id="n11423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daily</hi>, Q. Caepio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 174</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
cottius: <entryFree id="n11424" type="main" key="Cotti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cottĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two kings of northern Italy, the father, who was a contemporary and friend of Augustus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl> and 7, <hi rend="ital">and the son</hi> (cf. Dio Cass. 60, 14), <hi rend="ital">after whose death Nero made the country a Roman province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11424.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11424.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cottĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Cottian</hi>: Alpes Cottiae, <hi rend="ital">the Cottian Alps, west of</hi> Augusta Taurinorum, <hi rend="ital">whose highest point is</hi> Alpis Cottia, now <hi rend="ital">Mont Genèvre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11424.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cottĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotton: <entryFree id="n11425" type="main" key="Cotton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cotton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Æolis, in Asia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cottus: <entryFree id="n11426" type="main" key="Cottus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cottus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Cotys.</entryFree>
cotula: <entryFree id="n11427" type="greek" key="co^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏtyla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kotu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n11427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vessel, as a measure, equal to a</hi> hemina or <hi rend="ital">half a</hi> sextarius, Fann. Pond. 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 71, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 6, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coturnium: <entryFree id="n11428" type="main" key="coturnium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coturnium</orth>, i. q. cuturnium, q. v.</entryFree>
coturnix: <entryFree id="n11429" type="main" key="co_^turnix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^turnix</orth> (ō, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 641</bibl>; <sense id="n11429.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ŏ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 97</bibl>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a sono vocis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 4</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a quail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 64 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:7 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 7 al.</bibl>—As a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotyla: <entryFree id="n11430" type="main" key="co^ty^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. cotula.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11431" type="main" key="Co^ty^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 10, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotyledon: <entryFree id="n11432" type="greek" key="co^ty^le_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏtylēdon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kotulhdw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n11432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, navelwort</hi>: Cotyledon umbilicus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 101, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotys: <entryFree id="n11433" type="main" key="Co^ty^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtys</orth>, <itype>tyis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -tȳn, rarely -tym; <case>abl.</case> -tye), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/tus</foreign>, <sense id="n11433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Thracian princes</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11433.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ruler of the coast of Thrace</hi> B. C. 382-356, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of Iphicrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timoth. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl>, ext. 7.—</sense><sense id="n11433.2" n="II" level="1"> Cotys II., <hi rend="ital">king of the Odrysæ, an ally of Perseus in his war against Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 29, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:10" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 51, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67:4" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 67, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11433.3" n="III" level="1"> Cotys III., <hi rend="ital">king of the Odrysæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11433.4" n="IV" level="1"> Cotys V., <hi rend="ital">grandson of</hi> III., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 64</bibl> sqq.; 4, 5.—</sense><sense id="n11433.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brother of Mithridates, prince of the Bosporus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotytto: <entryFree id="n11434" type="main" key="Co^tytto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtytto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kotuttw/</foreign>, <sense id="n11434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of lewdness, who was originally worshipped in Thrace, later in Athens also</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 92</bibl>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏtyttia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kotu/ttia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">her festival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:56" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cous: <entryFree id="n11435" type="main" key="Co^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Cos.</entryFree>
coutor: <entryFree id="n11436" type="main" key="co^u_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ūtor</orth>, <itype>ūti</itype>, <sense id="n11436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n.</hi>: aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to associate with, have dealings with</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">sugxrh=sqai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
covinarius: <entryFree id="n11437" type="main" key="co^vi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏvīnārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏvinn-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>covinus</etym>, <sense id="n11437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier who fought from a chariot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35</bibl> and 36.</sense></entryFree>
covinus: <entryFree id="n11438" type="foreign" key="co^vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏvīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏvinn-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n11438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a war-chariot of the Britons and Belgæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 426</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:422" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 422</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a travelling chariot, a kind of tilbury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coxa: <entryFree id="n11439" type="main" key="coxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hip</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11439.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 8, 10, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 38</bibl>; cf. also coxendix.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11439.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hip-bone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11439.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <cb n="CRAS" /> in the Agrimensores: agrorum, <hi rend="ital">a bend inwards</hi> (with angulus), Sic. Fl. p. 6 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
coxendix: <entryFree id="n11440" type="main" key="coxendix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coxendix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (ī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 40</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 6</bibl>; <sense id="n11440.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">I,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 702</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">968</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with coxa</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the hip</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11440.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11440.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hip-bone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 61, 81, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:179" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 49, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coxim: <entryFree id="n11441" type="main" key="coxim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coxim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>coxa; cf.: cessim, cossim</etym>, <sense id="n11441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the hips</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">insidens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 129, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coxo: <entryFree id="n11442" type="gloss" key="coxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coxo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coxa</etym>, <sense id="n11442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hobbling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 25, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crabatus: <entryFree id="n11443" type="main" key="cra_^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crā^bātus</orth> = grabatus, q. v.</entryFree>
crabra: <entryFree id="n11444" type="main" key="Crabra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crabra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ae</orth>) <itype>aqua</itype>, <sense id="n11444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aqueduct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">water conduit that extended from Tusculum to the Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crabro: <entryFree id="n11445" type="main" key="cra_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crābro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hornet</hi>: Vespa crabro, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:71 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 71 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 335</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:245 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 245 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">irritare crabrones,</quote> <trans><tr>to stir up a hornet's nest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cracca: <entryFree id="n11446" type="main" key="cracca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cracca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pulse</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">wild vetch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 41, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cracens: <entryFree id="n11447" type="hapax" key="cra^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crăcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> <etym>kindr. with gracilis; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">C</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n11447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slender, neat, graceful</hi>: cracentes = graciles, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 7</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 497 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
cragos: <entryFree id="n11448" type="main" key="Cra^go^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crăgŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n11448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory and chain of mountains in Lycia, the abode of the Chimæra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 27, 28, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 646</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crambe: <entryFree id="n11449" type="greek" key="crambe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crambē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kra/mbh</foreign>, <sense id="n11449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cabbage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 79</bibl>.—Prov.: crambe repetita, <hi rend="ital">warmed over</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">something repeated, an old story</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cranii: <entryFree id="n11450" type="main" key="Crani^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cranĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra/nioi</foreign>, <sense id="n11450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of a town on the island of Cephallenia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Granea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cranon: <entryFree id="n11451" type="main" key="Cra_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crānon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Crann-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra/nwn</foreign>, <sense id="n11451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly, in the Vale of Tempe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:7" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 64, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>, ext. 7.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crānōnĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cranon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crantor: <entryFree id="n11452" type="main" key="Crantor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crantor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra/ntwr</foreign>. <sense id="n11452.0" n="I" level="1"> In fable, <hi rend="ital">the armor-bearer of Peleus, slain by the centaur Demoleon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11452.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished Grecian philosopher of the old Academic school</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 44, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crapula: <entryFree id="n11453" type="greek" key="cra_pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crāpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kraipa/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n11453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excessive wine-drinking, intoxication, inebriation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 142</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11453.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a resin producing intoxication, which was sometimes mingled with wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 24, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crapularius: <entryFree id="n11454" type="hapax" key="cra_pu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crāpŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crapula</etym>, <sense id="n11454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to intoxication</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctio,</quote> <trans><tr>preventive of inebriation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crapulatio: <entryFree id="n11455" type="main" key="cra_pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crāpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intoxicating</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crapulatus: <entryFree id="n11456" type="main" key="cra_pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crāpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drunken with wine, inebriated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:77:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 77, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crapulentus: <entryFree id="n11457" type="main" key="cra_pu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crāpŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very much intoxicated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crapulosus: <entryFree id="n11458" type="main" key="cra_pu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crāpŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclined to drunkenness</hi> (late Lat.): libidines, Firm. Math. 8, 20.</sense></entryFree>
cras: <entryFree id="n11459" type="main" key="cra_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crās</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>root ka-, ku-, to lighten, burn; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kai/w</foreign>; cf. Sanscr. cvas, the same</etym>, <sense id="n11459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to-morrow</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">au)/rion</foreign> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11459.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">tempp. fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus cras cum filio Cum primo luci ibo hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scies fortasse cras, summum perendie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras donaberis haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui non est hodie, cras minus aptus erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 94</bibl></cit> et saep.—With ellipsis of verb: <cit><quote lang="la">negat Eros hodie: cras mane putat (sc. venturum esse),</quote> <trans><tr>early to-morrow morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11459.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">temp. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat habeo, si cras fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras est mihi Judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 468, 24</bibl>:. cras nato Caesare festus dat veniam somnumque dies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 9 al.</bibl>—As the title of a writing of Varro: Cras credo, hodie nihil, of which there are some fragments ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 112, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11459.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras istud quando venit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:58:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 58, 2</bibl></cit> sqq.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hesternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:68" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 68</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11459.4" n="B" level="2"> = in diem <cb n="CRAS" /> crastinum, <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the morrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras te non vocavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:37:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 37, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11459.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the future, hereafter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit futurum cras, fuge quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credula vitam Spes fovet et melius cras fore semper ait,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:216 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 216 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crassamen: <entryFree id="n11460" type="main" key="crassa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>crasso</etym>, <sense id="n11460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thick sediment of a liquid, the dregs</hi> (cf. crassamentum, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:25:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:2" default="NO">12, 42, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassamentum: <entryFree id="n11461" type="main" key="crassa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.), <sense id="n11461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thickness</hi> of an object. </sense><sense id="n11461.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">portarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11461.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the thick sediment of a liquid, the dregs, grounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crasse: <entryFree id="n11462" type="main" key="crasse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1, crassus <sense id="n11462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
crassedo: <entryFree id="n11463" type="main" key="crasse_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crassus</etym>, <sense id="n11463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness</hi>, fig.: ingenii, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, Fulg. cont. Verg.</sense></entryFree>
crassesco: <entryFree id="n11464" type="main" key="crassesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n11464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to grow thick, to thicken, grow dense</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hard, grow large</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fat</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Pliny the elder): turtures milio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 18, 32, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceparum capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pili quadrupedibus senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel (opp. dilutum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 13, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër in nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassescente limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crassianus: <entryFree id="n11465" type="main" key="Crassi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crassĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2, Crassus.</entryFree>
crassicius: <entryFree id="n11466" type="main" key="Crassi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crassĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grammarian of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassificatio: <entryFree id="n11467" type="main" key="crassi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crassifico</etym>, <sense id="n11467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making thick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fat;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">thickness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:56" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassifico: <entryFree id="n11468" type="main" key="crassi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crassusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n11468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make thick, thicken, make fat, fatten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:208" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:2:39 al" default="NO">5, 2, 39 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Pass., to thicken, become dense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:180" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassipes: <entryFree id="n11469" type="main" key="Crassi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crassĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype> <etym>crassus-pes, thickfoot</etym>, <sense id="n11469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the</hi> gens Furia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 42, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the most celebrated is</hi> Furius Crassipes, <hi rend="ital">Cicero's son-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crassitas: <entryFree id="n11470" type="main" key="crassi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crassus</etym>, <sense id="n11470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness, density</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 65, 15.</sense></entryFree>
crassities: <entryFree id="n11471" type="main" key="crassi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness, density</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 189, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassitius: <entryFree id="n11472" type="main" key="Crassi^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crassĭtĭus</orth>, v. Crassicius.</entryFree>
crassitudo: <entryFree id="n11473" type="main" key="crassi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crassus</etym>, <sense id="n11473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness, density</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11473.1" n="I" level="1"> Abstr. (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">postes ...Quantā firmitate facti et quantā crassitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libramentum, in quo nulla omnino crassitudo sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 5 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites feminis crassitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 47, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ostrea) crassitudine potius spectanda quam latitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11473.2" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a thick matter, dregs, sediment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 90, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassivenius: <entryFree id="n11474" type="hapax" key="crassi^ve_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassĭvēnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crassusvena</etym>, <sense id="n11474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having thick veins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crasso: <entryFree id="n11475" type="main" key="crasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crasso</orth>, no <sense id="n11475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crassus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make thick, thicken, condense</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pili crassantur in setas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassatus aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crassundia: <entryFree id="n11476" type="hapax" key="crassundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassundĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thick intestines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=111" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 111</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
crassus: <entryFree id="n11477" type="main" key="crassus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. kart-, to spin; cf.: crates, cartilago, etc.</etym>; as opp. to flowing, thin, lean, delicate, etc., <sense id="n11477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">solid, thick, dense, fat, gross</hi>, etc. (freq. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n11477.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina (opp. liquida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1259</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crassius semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>greatly swollen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terga (agri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:40" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">filum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">restis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti crassi tres, as a measure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11477.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of the atmosphere, <hi rend="ital">thick, dense, heavy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër crassus et concretus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crassissimus aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum Thebis (opp. tenue Athenis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baeotum in crasso jurares aëre natum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 50</bibl>: caligo nubis, Lucr. <pb n="478" /> <cb n="CRAT" /> 6, 461; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caliginis aër Crassior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:350 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 350 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum crassiore visu,</quote> <trans><tr>less transparent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11477.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): crassum infortunium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a sound beating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: senes, <hi rend="ital">stupid, dull</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ofellus Rusticus abnormis sapiens crassāque Minervā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dull, stolid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crassiore ut vocant Musa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentia,</quote> <trans><tr>stupid, clumsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: crassiora nomina, <hi rend="ital">more rude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barbarous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crassē</orth> (rare; not in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">thickly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11477.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">picare vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oblinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 46" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11477.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Grossly, rudely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crasse illepideve compositum poëma (the figure taken from a coarse web),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—Of precious stones, <hi rend="ital">not clearly, dimly</hi> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:114" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 8, 36, § 114</bibl>.—Hence of the indistinct understanding of any thing, <hi rend="ital">not clearly, confusedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crasse et summatim et obscure intellegere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11478" type="main" key="Crassus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crassus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family name in the</hi> gens Licinia. The most distinguished were, </sense><sense id="n11478.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Licinius Crassus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated orator, a contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl> et saep.; cf. id. Brut. prol. pp. 68-77 Ellendt.—</sense><sense id="n11478.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Licinius Crassus, <hi rend="ital">the triumvir</hi>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crassĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the triumvir Crassus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitūs clades (in the war with the Parthians),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassiana clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crastinus: <entryFree id="n11479" type="main" key="crasti^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crastĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cras</etym>. <sense id="n11479.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of to-morrow; to-morrow's</hi> (freq. and class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 15, 54 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">Titan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:345" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 244</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stella diurna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: hora. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 425</bibl>: tempora, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:42" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 26 al.</bibl></cit>—In Gr. constr., of the person: <cit><quote lang="la">crastinus aspicis Triobrem ( = cras),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 24, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crastĭ-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">to-morrow, the morrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 620" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 620</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11479.1" n="b" level="4"> Die crastini, old <case>abl.</case> of time (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 25</bibl> (34) Lorenz ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 24, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3, 16</bibl>; Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 20 sq.</bibl>; and v. pristinus, proximus, quartus, quintus, nonus, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11479.2" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n11479.3" n="(a)" level="5"> In crastinum, <hi rend="ital">to-morrow, on the morrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos vocabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 60</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:16 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 16 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11479.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Crastino = cras, <hi rend="ital">to-morrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges non metetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11479.5" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to cras, C.) <hi rend="ital">Future</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid crastina volveret aetas Scire nefas homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:562" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 562</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:15:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 15, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11480" type="main" key="Crasti^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crastĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:46 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 46 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crataegis: <entryFree id="n11481" type="greek" key="cra^taegis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crătaegis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the plant</hi> satyrion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 63, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crataegon: <entryFree id="n11482" type="greek" key="cra^taegon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crătaegon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">crătaegŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krataigw/n</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">kra/taigos</foreign>, <sense id="n11482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called in pure Lat. aquifolia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 40, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crataegum: <entryFree id="n11483" type="greek" key="cra^taegum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crătaegum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krataigo/n</foreign>, <sense id="n11483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the kernel of the fruit of the box-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 52, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crataeis: <entryFree id="n11484" type="main" key="Cra^taeis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crătaeis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krataii/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of Scylla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 749</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 65</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crataeogonon: <entryFree id="n11485" type="greek" key="cra^taeo^go^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crătaeŏgŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">crătaeŏgŏnŏs</orth>,, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krataio/gonon</foreign>, <sense id="n11485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the common fleawort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:62 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 40, § 62 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crater: <entryFree id="n11486" type="main" key="cra_te_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, v. cratera.</entryFree>
cratera: <entryFree id="n11487" type="greek" key="cra_te_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātēra</orth> (acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 10</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 547, 25 sq.</bibl>, sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">crē-terra</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Trag. Rel. v. 45" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 45</bibl> Rib.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">crātēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krath/r</foreign>, Ion. <foreign lang="greek">krhth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n11487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel in which wine was mingled with water, a mixing-vessel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bowl</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n11487.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n11487.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Cratera, ae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 131</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=387" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 30</bibl>; Inscr. Orell 1541 al.—<hi rend="ital">Abl. plur.</hi> crateris, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> p. 2727</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 604 Vahl.; al. crateribus).—</sense><sense id="n11487.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Crater, ēris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 669</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:522" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 522</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), <cb n="CREA" /> 17, 37 al.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Gr. cratēra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 525</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 679</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 44</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> crateras, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 724</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 165</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11487.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel for drawing water, a bucket, water-pail</hi>: cratera, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 547, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An oil-vessel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A water-basin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The aperture of a volcanic mountain, the crater</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 701</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A volcanic opening of the earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 424</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bay near Baiæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11487.11" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A constellation, the Bowl.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11487.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Cratera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=219" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 219</bibl> (also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n11487.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Crater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:266" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 266</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> craterem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
craterites: <entryFree id="n11488" type="greek" key="cra^te^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crătĕrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kratero/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very hard unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
craterus: <entryFree id="n11489" type="main" key="Cra^te^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crătĕrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ros</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kratero/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11489.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A general of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:1 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11489.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous physician at Rome in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crates: <entryFree id="n11490" type="main" key="Cra^tes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n11490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11490.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Theban philosopher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 26</bibl> Bip.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 126 sq.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11490.2" n="II" level="1"> Crates Mallotes, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11490.3" n="III" level="1"> Crates, <hi rend="ital">an Academic philosopher of Athens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11491" type="spur" key="cra^tes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, falsely assumed as <case>nom.</case> instead of cratis, q. v.</entryFree>
crathis: <entryFree id="n11492" type="main" key="Cra_this"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crāthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra=qis</foreign>, <sense id="n11492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in</hi> Magna Graecia, <hi rend="ital">whose water was said to redden the hair</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Crati</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Gratti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 9, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 10, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:581" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 581</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
craticius: <entryFree id="n11493" type="main" key="cra_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cratis</etym>, <sense id="n11493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">composed of wicker-work, wattled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <trans><tr>lattice-work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
craticula: <entryFree id="n11494" type="main" key="cra_ti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, prop., <sense id="n11494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fine hurdle - work;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a small gridiron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:221:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 221, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
craticulum: <entryFree id="n11495" type="gloss" key="craticulum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">craticulum</orth> a Graeco <foreign lang="greek">krateu=tai</foreign> deducitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 11</bibl> Müll. [more prob. immediately from crates].</entryFree>
craticulus: <entryFree id="n11496" type="hapax" key="cra_ti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [cratis], <hi rend="ital">composed of lattice-work, wattled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: aliter alii.</sense></entryFree>
cratinus: <entryFree id="n11497" type="main" key="Cra^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crătīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krati=nos</foreign> <sense id="n11497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian comic poet of the old comedy, a contemporary of Eupolis and Aristophanes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:123" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cratio: <entryFree id="n11498" type="main" key="cra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cratis</etym>, <sense id="n11498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to harrow</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">herbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cratippus: <entryFree id="n11499" type="main" key="Cra^tippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crătippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kra/tippos</foreign>, <sense id="n11499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished peripatetic philosopher at Athens, a teacher of Cicero's son</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cratis: <entryFree id="n11500" type="main" key="cra_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n11500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> only <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art.
