Vet. 1, 56, 5</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> cratim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 65</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. kart, to spin; cf. crassus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">wicker-work, a hurdle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11500.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11500.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11500.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">flexilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:126" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 44, 61, § 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11500.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (so most freq.; and by the ancient gram. sometimes regarded as <number>plur.</number> tantum; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 455),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11500.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n11500.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A harrow; sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:173" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 18, 48, § 173</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11500.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hurdle</hi> with which criminals were covered, and on which stones were thrown; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11500.8" n="3" level="3"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">fascines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68 al.</bibl> —As <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> for besiegers in attacks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11500.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The ribs of a shield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 633</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:522 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 522 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11500.10" n="5" level="3"> = testudo, <hi rend="ital">the interlocked shields</hi> of a rank of soldiers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 485</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11500.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a joint, rib</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 370</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <trans><tr>the joints of the backbone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:806" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorum,</quote> <trans><tr>honey-comb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratem facit vitis,</quote> <trans><tr>grows confusedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:1 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 1 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cratitius: <entryFree id="n11501" type="main" key="cra_ti^tius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crātĭtius</orth>, v. craticius.</entryFree>
creabilis: <entryFree id="n11502" type="main" key="cre^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>creo</etym>, <sense id="n11502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be</hi> <cb n="CREB" /> <hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">created</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. 85, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:19 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 19 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
creagra: <entryFree id="n11503" type="greek" key="cre^a_gra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕāgra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krea/gra</foreign>, <sense id="n11503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fleshhook</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 997</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 4, 11</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
creamen: <entryFree id="n11504" type="main" key="cre^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>creo</etym>, <sense id="n11504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the elements of which created things consist</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 505</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
creatio: <entryFree id="n11505" type="main" key="cre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (very rare). <sense id="n11505.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A creating, producing, begetting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:15:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 15, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hujus creationis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not of man's building</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11505.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An electing to an office, a choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:39:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 39, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
creator: <entryFree id="n11506" type="main" key="cre^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n11506.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A creator, author, begetter, founder</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11506.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): ipse deūm, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64; cf. thus of <hi rend="ital">a father</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 309</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creator atque opifex rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus urbis, Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11506.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The creator of the world</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">God</hi> (eccl. Lat.), opp. creatura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 4, 19.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, Macc. 7, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:24:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eccli. 24, 12 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11506.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who elects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appoints to an office</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 31, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:8:2:section=7 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 8, 2, § 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
creatrix: <entryFree id="n11507" type="main" key="cre^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>creator</etym>, <sense id="n11507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who brings forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produces, a mother</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">natura rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:630 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 630 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea, patria (with genetrix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva (of a mother),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 534</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandri Magni, Olympias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 40" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira bellorum (tellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:184" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fid. 4, 30, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
creatura: <entryFree id="n11508" type="main" key="cre^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>creo</etym>, only concr., <sense id="n11508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a creature, thing created</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 508</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes creaturae tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11508.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The creation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus caelorum et Dominus totius creaturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:3:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 3, 14 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
creber: <entryFree id="n11509" type="main" key="cre_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype> (<sense id="n11509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> creberrimus; <cit><quote lang="la">but crebrissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Rudd. I. p. 170; <cit><quote lang="la">and CEREBERRIMVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 68</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from cre-, root of cresco, Corn. Beitr. p. 356</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that exists</hi> or <hi rend="ital">takes place in a continuous multitude, following closely together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one after another</hi> (hence with continuus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 46</bibl>; opp. rarus). </sense><sense id="n11509.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Thick, close, pressed together, frequent, numerous, repeated</hi> (very freq., and class.). </sense><sense id="n11509.2" n="A" level="2"> Of material subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus avius, Crebro salicto oppletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris arboribus succisis omnes introitus erant praeclusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venae et arteriae) crebrae multaeque, toto corpore intextae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funale,</quote> <trans><tr>numerous torches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creberrima aedificia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes quam creberrimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 98:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 98, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto crebriores litterae nuntiique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exploratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam crebri ad terram decidebant quam pira,</quote> <trans><tr>as thick as pears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebri cecidere caelo lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 37, 7</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n11509.3" n="B" level="2"> Of immaterial subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">itiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">excursiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:935" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 935</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 294</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutationes aestuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:538 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 538 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <trans><tr>oft repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplosio pedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebriores figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae apud Sallustium rare fuerunt, apud hunc crebra sunt et paene continua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra lumina (dicendi) et continua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11509.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of an object that is furnished with abundance, or produces something in multitudes, <hi rend="ital">crowded with, abundant, abounding in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creber harundinibus lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africus procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis creber ac subitus incrementis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 55</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of speech or writing: <cit><quote lang="la">sane in eo creber fuisti, Te noluisse, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>you frequently said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi tantum esset otii, quantum est tibi ... in scribendo multo essem crebrior quam tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Thucydides) ita creber est rerum frequentia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 7, 29</bibl>: quis sententiis aut acutior aut crebrior? id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 102</bibl> (cf.: densus sententiis, id. <pb n="479" /> <cb n="CRED" /> ib. § <cit><quote lang="la">68).—In Gr. constr., of the person: densis ictibus heros Creber utrāque manu pulsat versatque Dareta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus (dicendi) translationibus crebrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n11509.5" n="1" level="3"> Most freq. in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">close one after another</hi> (in time or number), <hi rend="ital">repeatedly, often, oftentimes, frequently, many times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si crebro cades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruri esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussire et exspuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:5:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personare purgatam aurem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui crebro Catulum, saepe me, saepissime rem publicam nominabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> crebrius: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucet villa crebrius quam cribrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with more holes, openings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrius aut perfidiosius rebellantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> creberrime (creberru-): <cit><quote lang="la">commemorantur a Stoicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11509.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crē-bră</orth> (<hi rend="ital">acc. plur.;</hi> cf. Rudd. II. p. 159), <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">revisit ad stabulum (mater),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pede terram Crebra ferit (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 500</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11509.7" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">closely, compactly</hi> (of place; <cit><quote lang="la">only in Vitr.): fundamenta aedificiorum palationibus crebre fixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates ex virgis creberrime textae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11509.8" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crē-brĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">repeatedly, frequently</hi> (in time), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 7</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 133 sq.</sense></entryFree>
crebesco: <entryFree id="n11510" type="main" key="cre_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbesco</orth>, v. crebresco.</entryFree>
crebratus: <entryFree id="n11511" type="hapax" key="cre_bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>creber</etym>, <sense id="n11511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thick, close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telae pexitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crebre: <entryFree id="n11512" type="main" key="cre_bre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>creber</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 3.</entryFree>
crebresco: <entryFree id="n11513" type="main" key="cre_bresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbresco</orth> (in MSS. and edd. sometimes euphon. <orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, like rubesco</itype>, from ruber), brŭi, 3, <sense id="n11513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [creber], <hi rend="ital">to become frequent, to increase, grow strong;</hi> of a rumor, report, <hi rend="ital">to spread abroad</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Tac.): crebrescunt optatae aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus cum ipsā orationis celeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum crebescere fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia et impunitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 222</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fama cladis Germanicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—With a clause as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">per socios crebrescit vivere Agrippam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is noised abroad</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>.— Rare in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque rumor publice crebuerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247</bibl></cit>: tam multa bella ubique crebuerunt, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 17.</sense></entryFree>
crebrisuro: <entryFree id="n11514" type="gloss" key="cre_bri^su_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrĭsūro</orth>, <itype>apud Ennium significat vallum crebris suris id est palis munitum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 3</bibl>.</entryFree>
crebritas: <entryFree id="n11515" type="main" key="cre_bri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>creber</etym>, <sense id="n11515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness, closeness, frequency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissae venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: fluctuum, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 116</bibl> (3, 42 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebritas et magnitudo officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum (with concinnitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:327" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 327</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crebriter: <entryFree id="n11516" type="main" key="cre_bri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>creber</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 4.</entryFree>
crebritudo: <entryFree id="n11517" type="hapax" key="cre_bri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>creber</etym>, for crebritas, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 91, 30</bibl> dub.</entryFree>
crebro: <entryFree id="n11518" type="main" key="cre_bro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēbrō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>creber</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>
credibilis: <entryFree id="n11519" type="main" key="cre_di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>credo</etym>, <sense id="n11519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of belief, credible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credibile est quod sine ullo teste auditoris opinione firmatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl></cit> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi verissimum esse intellegebam, tamen credibile fore non arbitrabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61:section=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 90</bibl></cit> et saep.: magnum narras, vix credibile, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 52</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix credibile dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: credibile est, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:2" default="NO">5, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:19 al" default="NO">5, 10, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credibili fortior illa fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:618" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 618</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid credibile facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:110" default="NO">4, 2, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:19" default="NO">9, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo tyranni credibile judicium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:4" default="NO">6, 3, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">credibly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:1 al" default="NO">3, 11, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
credibiliter: <entryFree id="n11520" type="main" key="cre_di^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. credibilis <sense id="n11520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
credito: <entryFree id="n11521" type="hapax" key="cre_di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>credo</etym>, <sense id="n11521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to believe firmly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, p. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
creditor: <entryFree id="n11522" type="main" key="cre_di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>credo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n11522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a creditor</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11522.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 5</bibl>; Sen. <cb n="CRED" /> Ep. 87, 6; 119, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 84</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 65</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11522.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the belly, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 28, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
creditrix: <entryFree id="n11523" type="main" key="cre_di^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>creditor</etym>, <sense id="n11523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female creditor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:6:38 al" default="NO">42, 6, 38 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
creditum: <entryFree id="n11524" type="main" key="cre_di^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. credo, I. B.</entryFree>
credo: <entryFree id="n11525" type="main" key="cre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n11525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> creduam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creduas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creduat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creduis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> credier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">crevi for credidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. crat, crad, trust, and dha-; v. 2. do</etym>. </sense><sense id="n11525.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig. belonging to the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to give as a loan, to loan, lend, make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loan to</hi> any one: (vilicus) injussu domini credat nemini; <cit><quote lang="la">quod dominus crediderit, exigat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus credas male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">populis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui grandem pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae creditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum talenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutio rerum creditarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11525.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a loan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:117" default="NO">5, 10, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 19 sq.</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11525.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the circle of business (very freq. in every period and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11525.4" n="A" level="2"> With the prevailing idea of intended protection, <hi rend="ital">to commit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consign something to one</hi> for preservation, protection, etc., <hi rend="ital">to intrust to one</hi>, = committo, commendo (cf. concredo): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi is obiit mortem, qui mihi id aurum credidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 15</bibl></cit> (credere est servandum commendare, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 9</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">nummum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 112</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 115</bibl>, concredere): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus fidei potestatique (with committere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 4</bibl>, § 14: vitam ac fortunas meas, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militi arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque omnia alienissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se perfidis hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: pennis se caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 378</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 383</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">crede audacter quid lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus magnum timido pectori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi consilia omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanos sensus tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 422</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque novos soles audent se germina tuto Credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 333</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11525.5" n="B" level="2"> With the prevailing idea of bestowing confidence, <hi rend="ital">to trust to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confide in a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing, to have confidence in, to trust.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11525.6" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti suorum satis credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 72, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesenti fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules magis non confidere quam non credere suis militibus,</quote> <trans><tr>rather mistrusted their intentions than their valor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam amplius hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nimium colori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibulis talaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 731</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in eccl. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">Moysi et mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of pers., <hi rend="ital">to believe in, trust in</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est ergo credere in Deum, credendo adhaerere ad bene coöperandum bona operanti Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 77:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 77, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fidem habet sine spe ac dilectione, Christum esse credit, non in Christum credit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 144:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Serm. 144, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui credit in Filium habet vitam aeternam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 3, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11525.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To trust one in his declarations, assertions</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give him credence, to believe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurato, scio, plus credet mihi, quam jurato tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:284 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 284 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vin' me istuc tibi, etsi incredibile'st, credere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credit jam tibi de isto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui omnium rerum ipsus semper credit,</quote> <trans><tr>in every thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu deliberandum et concoquendum est, utrum potius Chaereae injurato in suā lite, an Manilio et Luscio juratis in alieno judicio credatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.9" n="b" level="4"> Mihi crede, <hi rend="ital">beliere me, confide in my words, upon my word</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)moi\ piqou=</foreign>, an expression of confirmation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 93 al.</bibl>; cf.: mihi credite, Cic. Cat. <cb n="CRED" /> 2, 7, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:254 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 254 al.</bibl>—In the same sense (but more rare in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">crede mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 133</bibl>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 361</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crede igitur mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credite mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.10" n="c" level="4"> Credor in poets several times equivalent to creditur mihi: <cit><quote lang="la">certe credemur, ait, si verba sequatur Exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:351" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 351</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditus accepit cantatas protinus herbas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 98</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 129</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cassandra) non umquam credita Teucris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 247</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.11" n="d" level="4"> Sibi, <hi rend="ital">to believe one's self, trust one's own convictions, be fully convinced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa dicta sunt sapienter et graviter, tum vel in primis, crede nobis, crede tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:74" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri malunt alieni erroris accessio, quam sibi credere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 24, 2</bibl></cit>: non satis sibi ipsi credebant, Auct. B. Alex. 6:—</sense><sense id="n11525.12" n="2" level="3"> With simple reference to the object mentioned or asserted, <hi rend="ital">to believe a thing, hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admit as true</hi>: velim te id quod verum est credere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 6</bibl>; cf.: credo et verum est, Afer ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miseram! quid jam credas? aut cur credas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fere libenter homines id quod volunt credunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi ista ... sed numquam sum addictus ut crederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid de se temere crederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Difficilis ad credundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1027" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1027</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res tam scelesta ... credi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo scelere, etiam cum multae causae convenisse unum in locum atque inter se congruere videntur, tamen non temere creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.13" n="b" level="4"> In gen. = opinor, arbitror, <hi rend="ital">to be of opinion, to think, believe, suppose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11525.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo ne aliud credam atque aliud nunties,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deserta et inhospita tesqua credis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortem crede bonumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos gravissimos sapientiae magistros aetas vetus credidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest ... falsum aliquid pro vero credi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo animi caelestis creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">24: Evander venerabilior divinitate creditā Carmentae matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego vos novisse credo, ut sit pater meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reliquum exercitum subsequi crederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: caelo tonantem credidimus Jovem Regnare. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">victos crederes,</quote> <trans><tr>one would have thought, one might have imagined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 23</bibl>; cf. Zumpt, Lat. Gr. § 528.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis praeter creditur ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Athin) peperisse Limnate creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditus est optime dixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:125 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 125 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credetur abesse ab eo culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sine causā creditum est, stilum non minus agere cum delet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 1 al.</bibl></cit>— So in the <hi rend="ital">abl. part. pass.</hi> credito, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11525.16" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: credo inserted, like opinor, puto, etc., and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=mai</foreign>, as a considerate, polite, or ironical expression of one's opinion, <hi rend="ital">I believe, as I think, I suppose, I dare say</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">credo, misericors est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 144</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so placed first,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mulciber, credo, arma fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 368</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut jam hic aderit, credo hercle, aut jam adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
credulitas: <entryFree id="n11526" type="main" key="cre_du^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdŭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>credulus</etym>, <sense id="n11526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easiness of belief, credulity</hi> (first freq. after the Aug. per.; never in Cic.): credulitas error est magis quam culpa, Plancus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 498</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 44</bibl>.—Of fishes trusting themselves to the hook, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 934</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 101</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">credulus.—As a person, together with Error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
credulus: <entryFree id="n11527" type="main" key="cre_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>credo, II. C. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n11527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that easily believes a thing, credulous, easy of belief, confiding</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11527.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11527.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fabulis stultissima persona est improvidorum et credulorum senum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: stultus auditor et <pb n="480" /> <cb n="CREN" /> credulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 432</bibl> et saep.—Of fishes trusting to the hook, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 858</bibl>; cf. credulitas; <cit><quote lang="la">and of animals anticipating no danger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11527.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego credulus illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:478" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 478</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11527.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>: nos in vitium credula turba sumus, Ov F. 4, 312.—</sense><sense id="n11527.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">aures regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credula res amor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 826</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes animi mutui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <trans><tr>full of confidence, confiding, trusting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama ( = facile credens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. Roth ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:page=210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. p. 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cremabilis: <entryFree id="n11528" type="gloss" key="cre^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕmābĭlis</orth>, <sense id="n11528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">combustible</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kau/simos</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
crematio: <entryFree id="n11529" type="main" key="cre^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cremo</etym>, <sense id="n11529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning, consuming by fire, cremation</hi> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 31, § 64</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 88.</sense></entryFree>
cremator: <entryFree id="n11530" type="main" key="cre^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burner, consumer by fire</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crementum: <entryFree id="n11531" type="main" key="cre_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cresco</etym>. <sense id="n11531.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Growth, increase</hi> (very rare): corporum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 169, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 149</bibl></cit> (incrementum, Sillig).—</sense><sense id="n11531.1" n="II" level="1"> Crementum est semen masculi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cremera: <entryFree id="n11532" type="main" key="Cre^me^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕmĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Etruria, near Veii, made famous by the heroic death of the Fabii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">La Varca</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Valca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:205" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 13</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cremerae legio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fabii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 155</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕmĕrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cremera</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">the day of the disastrous conflict at Cremera</hi> (with Alliensis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cremia: <entryFree id="n11533" type="main" key="cre^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕmĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> cremium, i, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:101:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 101, 4</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cremo</etym>, <sense id="n11533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry fire-wood, brushwood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:55:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 55, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cremo: <entryFree id="n11534" type="main" key="cre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. çar, çri, to boil, roast; cf. carbo</etym>, <sense id="n11534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn, consume by fire</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. comburo). </sense><sense id="n11534.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis silvas cremarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1242</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtam igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes collegas suos vivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatum poenam sequi oportebat, ut igni cremaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:7" default="NO">5, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem incendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cremare et diruere urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondem et herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 85</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cinerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11534.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11534.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the burning of the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">primus (Sulla) e patriciis Corneliis igni voluit cremari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortali corpore cremato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Catonis) a me corpus est crematum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 54, 55, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:79" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 79</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11534.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the burning of victims in sacrifices, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 637</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:639" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 639</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11534.5" n="C" level="2"> Of things devoted, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cremona: <entryFree id="n11535" type="main" key="Cre^mo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕmōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kremw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n11535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the town Cremona in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">on the Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl> et saep.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n11535.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕmōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cremona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 48</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕmōnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cremona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cremonisjugum: <entryFree id="n11536" type="main" key="Cremo_nis ju^gum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cremōnis jŭgum</orth>, <sense id="n11536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of the Pennine Alps</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Grimsel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
